item.title: Sudo With Touch ID
item.description: Security and convenience are not best of the friends. Good password/pin practices are not convenience (long, different for each system, random). Biometric authentication is somewhat a good compromise. Logging into your machine is a very repetitive task. I do it enough time is a day to be annoyed of long passwords. Additionally, I work a lot on command line so I do find myself running commands with sudo a lot. Here is something that help me reduce some annoyance out of these.
